text: Okay, today we have a special announcement, which is that the Institute has been awarded a $270,000 grant from the Survival and Flourishing Fund to support work on the AI Capabilities and Alignment Consensus Project, AICICP.
speaker: SPEAKER_00

text: ai cicp is a multi-year initiative designed to reshape the conversation around ai capabilities alignment and regulation by combining high-impact journal collections in-person discussion oriented workshops and academic media content for public outreach the project aims to bridge the divide between ai doomers and accelerationists through deeply exploring the meaning of world models and agency and what these concepts mean for ai developments
speaker: SPEAKER_00

text: Adam Saffron at the Allen Discovery Center at Tufts University is the creator, principal investigator, and organizing editor for this project.

text: Satyaki Mitra and Harshal Shah report.
speaker: SPEAKER_00

text: Over the course of the project, we have slowly crafted and improved an implementation of an active inference model deployed in a Microsoft AirSim drone with a goal of eventual real-world implementation.
speaker: SPEAKER_00

text: With a newly implemented sensor fusion and final improvements to the model, we have the tools necessary to begin moving to a real drone and will begin this new phase of the project.
speaker: SPEAKER_00

text: Here's a brief summary of the project.
speaker: SPEAKER_00

text: We developed a hierarchical active inference framework in AirSim that uses LIDAR and or depth camera data to infer latent suitability maps for navigation.
speaker: SPEAKER_00

text: The drone minimizes expected free energy to select feasible adaptive trajectories in complex environments, achieving high simulation success rates in GNSS-denied scenarios, GPS-denied scenarios.
speaker: SPEAKER_00

text: Michelle Venucci, intern, reports, with Peter Blum as thesis supervisor,
speaker: SPEAKER_00

text: After an initial thesis proposal, which focused on studying active inference in an agent whose internal states and dynamics are defined by a cellular automaton, we pivoted the research to a more theoretical discussion on intrinsic motivation as surprise minimization or knowledge shaking within the AI-XI model setting.

text: Updated versions of the thesis draft can be found at this website.

text: Intern Allegra Grunberg reports,
speaker: SPEAKER_00

text: This research presents a novel theoretical framework for transforming the employment ecosystem through the integration of the free energy principle, collective intelligence methodologies, and the adaptive socioeconomic system framework, operationalized via the SenseMaker tool.
speaker: SPEAKER_00

text: The study addresses critical misalignments between education provision, labor market demands, graduate preparedness, and recruitment processes within the UK employment ecosystem
speaker: SPEAKER_00

text: utilizing ucl ste app as a paradigmatic case study the proposed framework employs fep-based modeling to minimize stakeholder uncertainty optimize goal alignment and enhance job matching and skill development processes through systematic collection and analysis of micro narratives from 100 participants
speaker: SPEAKER_00

text: Comprising students, alumni, faculty, and employers, the research establishes a continuous feedback mechanism that identifies emergent properties within the employment system.
speaker: SPEAKER_00

text: This approach enables both reactive adaptation to current economic conditions and proactive anticipation of future labor market demand.
